other_tests.findings: Atrial fibrillation with slow ventricular response, low voltage in limb leads, rightward axis, poor R-wave progression with clockwise rotation, and diffuse nonspecific T-wave changes.

Moderate concentric left ventricular thickening (1.5 cm), ejection fraction 50%, mildly enlarged and hypokinetic right ventricle, severe biatrial enlargement, minimal mitral regurgitation, mild aortic insufficiency, moderate tricuspid regurgitation, and mild-to-moderate pulmonary hypertension.

Chronically occluded, well-collateralized posterior descending artery and diffuse, nonobstructive coronary artery disease. Elevated biventricular filling pressures, rapid y descent in right atrial pressure, and concordant respiratory variation of right and left ventricular pressures.

other_tests.procedure_name: Biopsy of the Right Ventricular Myocardium
other_tests.findings: Amyloid deposition (positive staining with both sulfated Alcian blue and Congo red), with no evidence of myocarditis, granulomas, or iron deposition.
Positive for anti-lambda staining, negative for kappa and transthyretin staining, confirming the diagnosis of AL amyloidosis.
Hypocellular marrow (<20% cellularity), plasma cells seen singly and in small clusters, monoclonal IgG lambda spike.
